parameters.name: Material_values
parameters.description: Array of material values for this component (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Config_opt
parameters.description: Configuration option as defined in swInConfigurationOpts_e

parameters.name: Config_names
parameters.description: Array of configuration names for this component

title: IComponent2.SetMaterialPropertyValues2
description: Sets the material properties for this component.
signature:
void SetMaterialPropertyValues2( 
   System.Object
Material_values
,
   System.Int32
Config_opt
,
   System.Object
Config_names
)

parameters.name: Material_values
parameters.description: Array of material values for this component (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Config_opt
parameters.description: Configuration option as defined in swInConfigurationOpts_e

parameters.name: Config_names
parameters.description: Array of configuration names for this component

remarks:
The material property values include the color (R,G,B values), reflectivity (ambient, diffuse, specular, shininess), transparency, and emission.
The format of Material_values is an array of doubles:
[
R, G, B, Ambient, Diffuse, Specular, Shininess, Transparency, Emission
]
To see a color change, you must:
Specify
R
,
G
, and
B
, each with a value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive. (These values are internally multiplied by 255.0 to determine the RGB color.)
Specify the reflectivity properties (
Diffuse
,
Specular
,
Shininess
(1.0 - Specular spread/Blurriness)), each with a value greater than 0.0 and less than or equal to 1.0.
Specify
Ambient
,
Transparency
and
Emission
, each with a value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.
Refresh the graphics area after calling this method.
